about.title: Hello!
body: Hello! My name is Joe. I'm a Software Developer based in the Midwest.
I enjoy working at all levels of the software stack. My current interests lie in full-stack development, progressive web apps, and serverless architecture.
Here are some technologies I've worked with recently:

education.summary: I've continued my education through various online resources including Udemy, Pluralsight, and more. My most recent experience was finishing a full-stack ReactJS + NodeJS developer course through Udemy.

After Butler, I took a semester off to teach myself Python to test the waters of the programming world. I found that I enjoyed programming and enrolled at Kansas State University to further my education. The instructors there were an essential part of establishing a core foundation I continue to build on today.
I attended Butler Community College on scholarship directly after high school. I tried my hand at a few different majors and eventually found myself gravitating towards Mathematics.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.summary: After graduation, I accepted an offer for a position at NetApp. I primarily worked with Python and TypeScript, but worked with and was exposed to many different technologies. I was always able to meet my commitments despite product requirements constantly evolving.
jobs.responsibilities: Software development, software testing, and project scoping on an HCI Deployment Engine.

jobs.title: Lead of Development
jobs.summary: During my time at K-State, I worked in the Information Technology Assistance Center as an IT Consultant. I was given the opportunity to lead a team of developers in building new solutions to replace antiquated tools and technologies. My time at iTAC was a great experience because it allowed me to grow as a developer while assisting those around me.
jobs.responsibilities: Software research and development, IT technical support, and new-hire training.

jobs.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
jobs.summary: While attending K-State, I worked as an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in the Department of Computer Science. This was an incredibly rewarding experience, as I was able to assist new students in establishing a fundamental understanding of Computer Science.
jobs.responsibilities: Assisted instructors with in-class activities, graded class assignments, and tutored students on the fundamentals of programming using Python.

projects.title: Crown Clothing
projects.summary: This is an e-commerce site I made as a final project in a Udemy course. I built it using React, Redux, and Express.js.

projects.title: What's the Weather?
projects.summary: This is one of the first apps I made with React. I built it using React, Express.js and the OpenWeather API.
